meanings.definition: A person who performs less well than expected or required.
meanings.sent1: The teacher offered extra help to the underachievers in the class.
meanings.sent2: The underachievers in the team struggled to keep up with their peers.
meanings.sent3: The underachievers joked about forming a club for those who always forget their homework.
meanings.sent4: The underachievers were like shadows, always falling short of the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The underachievers were like wilted flowers, lacking the nourishment needed to bloom.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who do not reach their full potential.
meanings.sent1: The school counselor organized a workshop for the underachievers to help them excel.
meanings.sent2: The underachievers in the company were given additional training to unlock their capabilities.
meanings.sent3: The underachievers decided to start a support group to motivate each other to aim higher.
meanings.sent4: The underachievers were a puzzle missing a few key pieces to reveal their true picture.
meanings.sent5: The underachievers were like dormant seeds waiting for the right conditions to grow.
